result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martazius J Brown

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Martazius J Brown appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Martazius J Brown.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial.  Parties are still in negotiations.  Court will hear a change of plea at 8:30 am on the morning of trial.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Jury trial remains scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed:  State's Motion in Limine.
Received and Filed:  State's Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court, defendant Martazius J Brown not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requests jury trial dates. Court granted the defenses request and scheduled a final pretrial and jury trial dates. Court ordered the following deadlines. Parties have until September 15th, 2022 to file any motions. Parties have until October 13th, 2022 to file any response. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court, defendant Martazius J Brown not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court, defendant Martazius J Brown not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by State that case is mis-tabbed to Branch 02 and requests to have case re-tabbed to Branch 40. Court orders case assigned Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Case adjourned, Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Martazius J Brown in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia; both appear by video.  Defendant Martazius J Brown in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 18CF2558. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective J. Lanza.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Martazius J Brown in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Martazius J Brown in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Martazius J Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
